info.description: AI is a broadly based multidisciplinary area comprising theoretical, experimental, and applied investigations of intelligent systems.
info.note: You may take at most one 500-level EECS course for the above requirements.

info.description: Computation plays an increasingly important role in modern biology. This is an interdisciplinary track.
info.note: This track is not open to Biology Majors.
requirements: a 3rd  ULCS course of student’s choice

info.description: Fast information storage and retrieval are crucial to many computer applications, and manipulating large data collections on servers or networks pose difficult challenges for computer professionals.

As social and market interactions become more computational, computer science has adopted more traditional economic concepts such as decentralized decision-making and allocation of resources. This is an interdisciplinary track.
info.note: You may take at most one 500-level EECS course for the above requirements This track is not open to Economics Majors.

info.description: Until recently most robots were stationary manufacturing devices, but they are rapidly evolving into mobile information gathering and decision-making platforms, with vision being perhaps their most important information gathering capability.
requirements: a 4th ULCS course of student’s choice

info.description: Security for hardware, software, and networked systems is one of the fastest growing areas of computer science.
requirements: a 4th ULCS course of student’s choice

info.description: Designing and developing large software systems is a formidable engineering challenge and is the primary enterprise of the software industry.
requirements: a 4th ULCS course of student’s choice

info.description: Software systems are the tools and applications we use when we compute.
requirements: a 4th ULCS course of student’s choice

info.description: Research on mathematical foundations has enormously influenced the development of computer science, yielding advances in data management, communications, security, and may other areas. This is an interdisciplinary track.
info.note: This track is not open to Math Majors.
requirements: two of the following: Math 412, 465, 425, 475, Stats 426, IOE 510, 512, 518, and EECS 550
